block.p: LEAD: The Commonwealth Edison Company of Chicago priced a two-part issue of first mortgage bonds totaling $350 million yesterday through underwriters led by Salomon Brothers Inc.
LEAD: The Commonwealth Edison Company of Chicago priced a two-part issue of first mortgage bonds totaling $350 million yesterday through underwriters led by Salomon Brothers Inc.
The Commonwealth Edison Company of Chicago priced a two-part issue of first mortgage bonds totaling $350 million yesterday through underwriters led by Salomon Brothers Inc.

A $125 million issue of noncallable mortgage bonds due in 2000 was given a 9 3/8 percent coupon and priced to yield 9.445 percent, or about 102 basis points more than Treasury securities with a similar maturity.

The remaining $225 million of bonds due in 2020 were given a coupon of 9 3/4 percent and priced to yield 9.94 percent, or about 146.5 basis points more than Treasury securities with a similar maturity. These securities, underwriters said, are noncallable by the utility for the first 10 years.
Both parts of the financing are rated Baa-1 by Moody's and BBB+ by S.& P.
